list_definition.definition: to hit or strike out with the foot

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He kicked the ball into the next garden
He kicked at the locked door

list_definition.definition: (of a gun) to jerk or spring back violently when fired.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The boy gave him a kick on the ankle
He was injured by a kick from a horse.

list_definition.definition: the springing back of a gun after it has been fired.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She gets a kick out of entertaining people.
